intro: Phyteuma spicatum proles alpestre, commonly known as the alpine phyteuma, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of bell-shaped, pale blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine meadows, thriving in well-drained, nutrient-poor soils. Its flowering period occurs in late summer, and it is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value. The species is notable for its ability to withstand cold climates and is a symbol of resilience in high-altitude ecosystems.
